title: Installation issue: qt@5.12.4
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack -d install -j1 qt@5.12.4 ^font-util fonts=encodings
/cvmfs/sft.cern.ch/lcg/releases/gcc/8.3.0-cebb0/x86_64-centos7/include/c++/8.3.0/cmath:45:15: fatal error: math.h: No such file or directory
```
(the `fonts=` specification is due to #12547).

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux 453207a49b28 3.10.0-1062.4.3.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Nov 13 23:58:53 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    CentOS Linux release 7.7.1908 (Core) 
``` 
compilers.yaml and packages.yaml: https://gist.github.com/iarspider/7a9a7685e9c93fb214b608bb85bf9f19

The issue is triggered by taking packages (in my case - `libjpeg` and `openssl`) from system. This adds `-I /usr/include` to the list of flags passed to `gcc`. But Qt automatically adds `-isystem /usr/include`. As far as I can tell after long googling, this messes up order of include dirs and, as a result, `#include_next` preprocessor instruction.

### Additional information

[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3960932/spack-build-out.txt)
[spack-cc-qt-jqmsy5g.in.log](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3960933/spack-cc-qt-jqmsy5g.in.log)
[spack-cc-qt-jqmsy5g.out.log](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3960934/spack-cc-qt-jqmsy5g.out.log)
